intro: Decaschistia crassiuscula, commonly known as the broad-leafed daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant is characterized by its broad, fleshy leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy perennial in suitable climates. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
